message: It's Dunwich's Laboratory.
On the desk, various pieces of experimental equipment are crammed together so tightly that, as a layperson, I have no idea what they're used for.
The sheer number of those items is a bit much for a rich man's hobby, making me imagine just what kind of suspicious research was going on in the Laboratory.
It's Dunwich's Laboratory.
The room is filled with a big Table crammed with all sorts of experimental equipment, and shelves packed with bottles of suspicious-looking chemicals in all kinds of shapes.

name: Cordelia
message: See, I'm sure it's gotta be here, right？
Cordelia looks around the room with a proud smile on her face.
It's true, it wouldn't be weird if anything was hiding here.
But when I checked this room before, there shouldn't have been anything like that.
Maybe I need to take a closer look.

name: Cordelia
message: Nn... this door won't open.
The door of the shelf lined with medicine bottles seems to have warped over time, and even when I try to force it open, it doesn't budge at all.

name: Jonathan
message: It won't open.

name: Cordelia
message: What should we do？

name: Jonathan
message: Well, whatever, let's try peeking inside through the glass.
I wonder if there's something‥‥‥‥
I peeked inside the shelf.
I peeked inside through the gap in the bottle, but I couldn't see any book or anything like a key.

name: Jonathan
message: Looks like there's nothing inside the shelf.
Well, a key is such a small thing, if you wanted to hide it, you could probably hide it just about anywhere.

name: Cordelia
message: That's not true, let me see it for a sec.
Cordelia shoved my body aside and peered into the shelf, practically pressing her face against the glass door.

name: Cordelia
message: That's weird...... I was sure it was here.

name: Jonathan
message: There’s nothing but medicine bottles in here.

name: Cordelia
message: Can't be helped, let's check out the others too.
Dust has piled up on the books lined up on the shelf, making you hesitate to touch them.
I can't tell what the book is about just from the title on the spine, but judging from the state of this room, it's probably a book related to science experiments.

name: Cordelia
message: How is it？
There's a Necronomicon.

name: Jonathan
message: Nah, I don't see any books like that.
It looks like everything lined up here is related to science experiments.

name: Cordelia
message: Really？
Take a good look, you're the only one who really knows what kind of book the Necronomicon is.
I let my eyes run over the books lined up on the shelf again.
Looks like the book I saw in my dream isn't here after all.

name: Jonathan
message: Looks like they're all from different books after all.

name: Cordelia
message: There are so many books here, and not a single one is the same. What the heck.

name: Jonathan
message: Can't be helped, it's not like that's something you just find lying around anywhere.

name: Cordelia
message: Do you have anywhere else in mind？
If it's not in this room......
Looks like the Dunwich family doesn't have any kind of appliances that use electricity at all.
This Lamp is also something that uses gas to provide light, and it seems to be one of the first things installed when gas lines were brought into ordinary homes.
It's true that doing experiments with just candlelight seems way too dark, but especially here in Arkham, there probably weren't many contractors who would take on the job.
Looks like a gas lamp.
It's super rare for an ordinary household to have something like this.
It was probably something someone who wasn't satisfied with just the weak light of candles set up, paying a hefty price for it.
A buret stuck in a glass bottle, a gas burner heating a flask, and so on are placed here.
Unlike now, glass test tubes and flasks were probably pretty expensive back then.
I'm impressed by all the equipment, but the Necronomicon itself doesn't seem to be anywhere.

name: Cordelia
message: Did you find it？

name: Jonathan
message: No, no good...... I can't find it anywhere.

name: Gardner
message: It's really here, right？
If there's really nothing here, then it's ridiculous to be crawling on all fours getting my clothes all dusty.

name: Cordelia
message: It's nowhere to be found.

name: Thomas
message: Let's just stop already.
There's no need to be so hung up on just this room.
There are all kinds of instruments lying around, and I have no idea what kind of experiments they're used for.
I don't know what kind of research the head of the Dunwich family was doing in this room, but I can't believe they'd spend this much money on something just for fun.
I glanced between the glass instruments shaped as intricately as candy art, searching to see if anything had fallen, but there was nothing that looked like a worthwhile find.
I wonder if the Necronomicon is somewhere else too.
At the very least, I don't see anything like that on the desk......
I picked up the folded Parchment, brushed off the dust, and spread it out.
Even after many years, the tough leather still hasn't lost its elasticity or strength.
The parchment is covered in fluent writing, and while it is written in English, the phrasing is a bit different from what you'd hear nowadays.
『My honored and venerable older brother━━
First, let us offer proper respect and prayers to the eternal power we worship.

『To state my conclusion in advance, I have no intention of accompanying you, my wise brother. Given the recent strict crackdown on people like us, I plan to move for a while and live a secluded, hidden life.』
『Luckily, I was able to get help from members of an organization called Tan Tavan, and considering the circumstances, I can only think of that as fortunate too.』

『I can only feel longing and envy for the new experimental grounds and the many test subjects my wise elder brother has acquired, and now that I've ended up in this situation, the only one qualified to be the contractor is my wise elder brother.』
『As written in that handwritten book in your possession, thus, from the seed of the old, one who looks back upon the past is born without knowing what they themselves ought to do.』
『If you believe those words, then I think any wish will eventually come true. After I'm gone, Naiarathotep will be your wise brother's advisor, just so you know.』
『This man, though his true nature is unknown, will surely bring fortune to my wise brother. He has already departed for that land, and it seems he will arrive there in a few months.』
The eternally unchanging loyal friend of the wise big brother
Joseph C』
It's a letter sent to someone in the Mansion by a person named Joseph C.
It's written in a pretty old-fashioned way, so it's tough to read.
I have no clue at all who 'wise brother' in the letter is supposed to be, but does 'a new place for experiments' mean this lab？
What the heck are 'the seeds of the old ones' or 'those who look back on the past' supposed to mean?
It's like I'm solving a crossword puzzle or something, and it's giving me a headache.
It felt like I saw a good example of how the ever-changing English language can turn into something totally incomprehensible if you go back just a hundred years.
Second floor hallway
